preface.title: Introduction
preface.para: Thumper is an implementation of the RFC-3161 secure time-stamping service. Both client and server programs are provided. The client is used to request time-stamps and the server, running as a trusted third party, is used to create time-stamps.

Security sensitive parts of the system are written in SPARK and proved free of run-time errors. Additional security and correctness properties are also proved in some cases. Certain aspects of the user interface code, deemed to be non-critical, are written in full Ada and take advantage of non-verified libraries such as GtkAda.
